verses.verse: In those days, as the crowd is very big and people do not have what they will eat, after calling for His students, Jesus says to them,
"I have sympathy on the crowd because already for three days they are still staying with Me and they do not have what they will eat.
And if I dismiss them with nothing to eat to their house, they will be exhausted on the road. You see, some of them have arrived from a distance."
And His students responded to Him, "Where will anyone be able to get loaves of bread from to make these people full here on an uninhabited place?"
And He was asking them, "How many loaves of bread do you have?" The students said, "Seven."

And He passed the order on to the crowd to settle down on the ground. And when He took the seven loaves of bread, after He was thankful, He tore them and was giving them to His students so that they might place them beside them. And they placed them beside the crowd.
And they had a few small fish. And after He conferred prosperity, He said to also place them beside them.
They ate and were full. And they picked up leftovers of torn pieces, seven big baskets.
The people eating were as if it were four thousand. And He dismissed them.
And right away after climbing on board into the boat with His students, He went to the parts of Dalmanutha.
And the Separatists came out and began to be posing questions to Him, looking for an indicator from the side of Him out from the sky, trying to cause trouble with Him.
And after groaning deeply to His spirit, He says, "Why is this generation looking for an indicator? Amen, I tell you, if an indicator will be given to this generation, may I be punished."
And after leaving them, when He again climbed on board into the boat, He went off to the other side.
And the students forgot to take loaves of bread, and except for one loaf of bread they did not have any with them in the boat.
And He was warning them, saying, "See. Look out for the yeast of the Separatists and the yeast of Herod."
And they were thoroughly considering to each other saying that they did not have loaves of bread.

And when Jesus knows it, He says to them, "Why are you thoroughly considering that you do not have loaves of bread? Are you not yet aware, nor understand? Do you still have your heart that has become hard as stone?
Having eyes, do you not see? And having ears, do you not hear? And do you not remember?
When I tore the five loaves of bread for the five thousand, how many full baskets of torn pieces did you pick up?" They say to Him, "Twelve."
"When I tore the seven for the four thousand, how many full big baskets of torn pieces did you pick up?" The students say, "Seven."
And He was saying to them, "How do you not understand?"
And He is coming into Bethsaida. And they bring a blind man to Him and encourage Him so that He might touch him.
And when He latched on to the hand of the blind man, He led him outside of the village. And after He spit into his eyeballs, when He placed the hands on him, He was asking him if he sees anything.
And when he looked up, he was saying, "I see the people as trees traipsing around."
After that, again He placed the hands on his eyes and made him look up. And he was reestablished and was seeing absolutely all far away things clearly.
And He sent him out to his house, saying, "Don't go into the village, nor tell it to anyone in the village."
And Jesus and His students went out to the villages of Caesarea of Philip, and on the road He was asking His students, saying to them, "Whom do the people say for Me to be?"
The students answered, "John the Submerger; and others, Elijah; but others, one of the preachers."
And He says to them, "But you, whom do you say for Me to be?" When Peter answers, he says to Him, "You are the Anointed King."
And He forbid them so that they may tell no one about Him.

And He began to be teaching them that it is necessary for the Son of the Person to suffer many things, to be rejected from the older men, head priests, and Old Testament transcribers, to be killed, and to get up after three days.
And He was speaking the message openly. And after Peter took Him aside, he began to be forbidding Him.
But when Jesus turned around and saw His students, He forbid Peter, saying, "Go back behind Me, opponent, because you do not focus on the things of God, but on the things of the people."
And when He called for the crowd together with His students, He said to them, "Anyone who wants to come behind Me, he must flatly deny himself, pick up his cross, and follow Me.
You see, whoever wants to rescue his soul will lose it, but whoever loses his soul on account of Me and the good news, this person will rescue it.
You see, what will it benefit a person if he will gain the whole world and sustain loss to his soul?
You see, what will a person give in exchange for his soul?

You see, whoever is ashamed of Me and My messages in this generation, the cheating and sinful one, the Son of the Person will also be ashamed of him when He comes in the magnificence of His Father with the angels, the sacred ones."
